operator.title: Decrypt File (Password)
operator.synopsis: Operator for decrypting files that were encrypted with the 'Encrypt File (Password)' operator.

text.paragraph: The operator expects a password encrypted file as input which is then decrypted with the provided password.

inputPorts.port: The file object which should be decrypted. If a file object is connected to the port, the parameter 'file input' is being ignored.

outputPorts.port: The decrypted input file is outputted here. If the port is connected, the parameter 'file output' is being ignored.

parameters.parameter: Defines the file that should be decrypted. If a file object is connected to the input port of the operator, the parameter is being ignored.
The password that should be used for file decryption.

This parameter allows to select the type of the algorithm used to decrypt the file.
This option selects the algorithm 'SHA1' to digest the password and 'RC2' to decrypt the file with the digested password. It should be used if the file has been encrypted with algorithm strength 'weak'.
This option selects the algorithm 'MD5' to digest the password and '256BITAES-CBC-OPENSSL' to decrypt the file with the digested password. It should be used if the file has been encrypted with algorithm strength 'medium'.
This option selects the algorithm 'SHA256' to digest the password and '256BITAES-CBC-BC' to decrypt the file with the digested password. It should be used if the file has been encrypted with algorithm strength 'strong'.
This option allows to define a user defined algorithm that should be used to decrypt the file. In case the JCE unlimited strength jurisdiction policy files have been installed, more algorithms will show up.
The parameter should be checked if the file that should be decrypted has been Base64 encoded after encrypting it.
Defines where the decrypted input file should be stored. If the file output port is connected, the parameter 'file output' is being ignored.
The operator does not override already existing files by default. If checked an already existing file will be overriden without an error.
